original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Cardiology
Discharge Summary
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT# :
**ID-NUM
ATTENDING :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 12 2007] 14:14:00
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Nov 25 2007]
This is a **AGE[in 60s]- year - old Afro - American female admitted via emergency room with complaint of left - sided chest pain radiating to the left upper arm , also complaining of severe shortness of breath and cough with hemoptysis .
She had been feeling poorly and blood pressure was elevated .
She carries diagnoses of myocardial infarction in the past , systolic congestive heart failure , paroxysmal atrial fibrillation , DVD pacemaker insertion , renal insufficiency , frequent episodes of chronic obstructive lung disease , tobacco abuse , hypertension , hypertensive cardiomyopathy , coronary artery disease , coronary artery stent , pulmonary embolism , mitral regurgitation , IVC filter , and right knee surgery .
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION :
Physical exam revealed severe bronchospasm , diffuse rhonchi , and wheeze .
Blood pressure 162/90 .
Superficial varicose veins .
No pitting edema .
Chest x-ray revealed no active disease .
Lower extremity venous Doppler was negative for deep venous thrombosis .
Ultrasound of the kidneys because of an elevated BUN was unremarkable .
LABORATORY DATA :
Initial BUN was 20 , creatinine 1.7 and it jumped to 62 and 2.2 on **DATE[Nov 16 2007] , potassium ranged as high as 5.9 on **DATE[Nov 22 2007] and dropped to 5.4 on **DATE[Nov 23 2007] .
Troponins were negative for myocardial infarction .
Hematocrit was 38.5 and dropped to 31.9 on **DATE[Nov 18 2007] .
BNP was 747 on **DATE[Nov 12 2007] and was dropping down to 461 on **DATE[Nov 13 2007] .
The patient had one blood culture positive for Propionibacterium acnes , but was considered contaminated by infectious disease consultant .
The patient was seen in nephrology consultation by Dr. **NAME[XXX] , infectious disease consultation by Dr. **NAME[WWW] , pulmonary consultation by Dr. **NAME[VVV] , and rheumatology consultation by Dr. **NAME[UUU] .
**INSTITUTION :
The patient was treated for severe chronic obstructive lung disease with exacerbation with intravenous steroids , subsequently changed to prednisone .
Because the left ventricular function was normal , beta - blockers which were previously given to the patient were tapered off completely .
Insulin coverage was given because of hyperglycemia from steroid therapy .
Dr. **NAME[UUU] saw for possible anti - IgE therapy .
The patient was then discharged home in good condition with expectation to readmissions are quite likely because of past history of noncompliance with medications and use of tobacco .
Home Care was ordered .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
Discharge medications were allopurinol 300 mg p.o. daily , Norvasc 5 mg p.o. daily , Lipitor 10 mg p.o. daily , Aranesp 100 mcg subcutaneously every 2 weeks , Lanoxin 0.125 mg daily , folic acid 1 mg p.o. daily , Mucinex 1200 mg b.i.d. , hydralazine 50 mg t.i.d. p.o. , Niferex 1 tablet p.o. daily , Imdur 30 mg p.o. daily , Singulair 10 mg p.o. daily ,
Protonix 40 mg p.o. daily , prednisone 20 mg b.i.d. p.o. , Prandin 4 mg t.i.d. p.o. , sodium bicarbonate 650 mg t.i.d. p.o. , Combivent 2 puffs q.i.d. , Lovenox 100 mg subcutaneously daily until INR would be more than 2 , and Coumadin 5 mg p.o. daily .
DIET :
1500 - calorie , low - potassium diet .
ACTIVITIES :
As tolerated .
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[YYY ZZZ] in 2 to 3 weeks .
FINAL DIAGNOSES :
1. Chronic obstructive lung disease with acute exacerbation .
2. History of atrial fibrillation .
3. Diastolic congestive heart failure .
4. Hyperkalemia .
5. Acute renal failure , exacerbation of chronic renal insufficiency .
6. Diabetes mellitus .
7. Severe pulmonary hypertension affected by pacemaker lead .
8. Concentric left ventricular hypertrophy and hypertensive cardiovascular disease .
9. Coronary artery disease , status post coronary artery stent .
10. Dual chamber pacemaker .
11. Past history of pulmonary embolism and inferior vena cava filter .
_________________________
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
DICTATED BY :
**NAME[YYY M. ZZZ] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Dec 02 2007] 17:22:39
T :
**DATE[Dec 03 2007] 01:49:56
R :
**DATE[Dec 03 2007] 01:49:56/sj
Job ID :
